userreviews.userReview: Priceless Masterpiece of Apocalyptic FictionI have read and re-read Eric A Shelman's Dead Hunger series. When l started reading zompoc fiction it was about a year or so after my 21 year old daughter was murdered by a sexual predator. Now, l say this, not for sympathy, but to tell you what this series has meant to me. I would lie in bed reading zompoc books, depressed and not feeling like l would ever get through this pain. I read the Dead Hunger series and felt like his characters were like family. I was invested and felt like l was there with this group. It made me happy, scared, sad, and at times jubilant. I am re-reading the series again and l can't say l will ever be the person l was before this, because like Gem, Flex, Hemp, Charlie, Trina, Taylor, Doc Scofield, Nelson, Rachel, Dave, Serena, Uncle Bug, Isis, Flexy Jr and Max, I'm a new normal. That is what this series helped me to see. The characters are so relatable that I could see my tragedy in a relatable way. They can't cure the apocalypse or go back to who or what they were. Just embrace a new normal with scars and pain with those you love. So, to me the characters are more than fictional, they're like friends that I keep returning to visit.

Masterfully written as Eric Shelman gives the major characters voice allowing the reader a unique look at each individuals point of view in their quest for a safe haven. The stakes are higher, if that's possible in this final (hopefully not!) book of the Dead Hunger series. But who would believe a greater threat that could devastate that which survives is around the corner. In Flex and Gem's case it arrives at their doorstep. Dave and Serena, along with Nelson have returned from California bringing with them Rachel, Lola, Dave's uncle Bug and his daughter Isis. They've managed to overcome so much in such a short time that the horror of what comes next is so unexpected. Compounding the problem is Isis who is unfortunately drawing every pregnant red-eyed female Zombie within a couple of hundred miles and they never come alone! Charlie is about to give birth and Hemp finds himself as helpless as any father to be as a monster storm approaches. Flex must leave Gem and his son to desperately seek help for what is sure to be a devastating end to any child born into this new world, his son at the forefront and zombies are at the gate! The tension mounts as the storm draws near and nothing will stop the Red-Eyes who have only one thought in their quasi intelligent minds...Isis. Flex will join forces with another in his quest, Hemp and company are fighting for survival as the zombies and storm close in and the race is on as to who will get to the finish line first.

I devoured this book and still hunger for more!I have read many, many, many- Post Apocalyptic/Zombie Apocalypse stories -99% of them being in a series- though some only having 3-5 books, others in the 10+ range. My love for long, Post-Apocalyptic Zombie/Infection series is what drew me to the Dead Hunger series. Every book in this series is amazing, always holding my attention and making me fall in love the characters! I don’t always fall in love with characters right away, but with Dead Hunger, I did. What sets the Dead Hunger series apart from many others is that while it does use science and logic -a great deal at that- it also has a supernatural aspect that adds to the mystery and charm...and even the fear of the unknown. What I find very unique and fascinating about it is that by using a combination of science and science fiction (paranormal) the Mr. Shelman is able to make the events in the story seem eerily plausible. As fantastical and intricate as it is, the world is presented to the reader at a pace that is easily digested -and unlike other stories which use a supernatural aspect- it leads the reader to believe that it might actually be possible for the world to succumb to a fate as described in the stories. Even 6 books in, we the readers are STILL learning about everything as it happens, as if we are right there with the survivors, learning, loving, losing -everything they feel, we feel just as deeply. Needless to say, I am really enjoying this ride, even though I have to check my pulse constantly, wondering if my heart can take the constant pounding. If you like stories that keep you captivated and enthralled, this one is for you. If you want something safe and boring, steer clear because it’s nowhere near safe, or boring.

The Gathering Storm was another amazing entry into the Dead Hunger series. Shelman's ability to run with so many different characters and keep things flowing and interesting is a rare gift. With each book I've grown rather attached to the characters. Each book, the plight set before the characters, the sense of family all resonates strongly and helps carry the books. I've never once been bored with this series from the start and am very happy to say The Gathering Storm continued that trend. I loved the fact the chronicles were told from both Flex and Gem's perspectives, it broke things up and added an interesting twist as it bounced back and forth. As always, plenty of action, laughs and intensity.Very interested to see where the story goes from here.

description: A Storm Is Brewing . . . Some of our old friends have returned home safely, to be with the ones they love and trust. Even as their warm greetings of welcome are offered, another threat builds on the horizon. It enters their home in the form of a little girl. What the child visitor carries within her is an adversary as single-minded and deadly as the zombie hordes themselves. It is known to have existed over 350 years, and it takes life without consideration of age or innocence. At the same time, another female child, unable to quell her siren call, beckons the Mothers. They, in turn, gather the Hungerers to follow. Join our family of survivors once again, and prepare to brace yourself against the coming onslaught.
